newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: East Asia to raise funds via shares sale.
newsitem.headline: East Asia to raise funds via shares sale.

text.p: Philippines' East Asia Power Resources Corp said on Friday it would sell new shares at a minimum price of 8.50 pesos apiece to raise funds to cover its capital requirements.
East Asia closed at 8.50 pesos on Friday.
Assistant corporate secretary Ildebrando Ambrosio told the Philippine Stock Exchange it needed to raise $65 million to finance projects to be undertaken by the company and its subsidiaries.
The power firm has appointed Philippine National Bank as its lead underwriter for the shares offering.

Ambrosio said East Asia had bought into Asia Pacific Power & Light Co Ltd which owns 51 percent of Taixing Huangquiao Pacific Power Co Ltd, operator of a 30-megawatt coal-fired power plant in Jiangsu province in China.
It had also acquired 100 percent of East Asia Power Services Inc, a firm engaged in providing operations and maintenance services to power plants.
East Asia is partly owned by Van der Horst Ltd of Singapore and Filinvest Development Corp of the Philippines. - Manila newsroom 63 2 8418938 Fax 8176267
